email: team email us explaining your problem
intro: The most awesome Spanish data science event that promotes gender diversity. One day of data talks and other to compete in a datathon which includes a prize for the winner. All of this in the wonderful place
jury-description-gema: Gema Parreño works as Data Scientist at BBVA. She designed Deep Asteroid, the architecture for a net to detect to detect asteroids’ impact on the Earth. She has developed some of the use examples for the Tensorflow project, as well as software and tutorials for games based on DeepMind’s PySC2, such as StarCraft.
jury-description-ibon: Ibon Tolosana works as Platform Engineer at Plato and also works remotely for foreign companies. He has been professionally developing software for more than 20 years and is Technical Cofounder of companies like Juegon.com, Novoplay or Ludei. He loves to create and enjoy computer-generated art, algorithmics, chocolate and compulsively developing side projects.
jury-description-irene: Irene Rodríguez works as Senior Data Scientist at Openbank and Associate Researcher at the Computer Engineering Department of the Autonomous University of Madrid (UAM). Se has a PhD in Computer Engineering and a degree in Mathematics in the UAM. Her interests are pattern recognition and its practical applications in fields such as Bioinformatics, electronic noses, or the banking industry, among others.
jury-description-jorge: Jorge Barroso is Developer and Cofounder at Karumi, and Google Developer Expert in Android. He worked at Tuenti from 2009 to 2013 in the Android’s team. He has participated in several mobile projects of the company, like j2me, Blackberry and Android. Before Tuenti, he had worked at several companies developing games for mobile devices, and multiplayer games.
newsletter-form-message: We won't bother you much, just to tell you how the event is going
notify: Do you want to get the latest news?
text-dataton-1: The Call Of Data datathon will take place June 3rd, the second day of the event. The dataset will be revealed first thing in the morning and the teams will have 8 hours to prepare an interesting project using this data. At the end of the day, teams will have the opportunity to present their project to the jury in an elevator pitch format, which gives the speaker 5 minutes to make her/his case.
text-dataton-2: This competition is about promoting diversity in STEM fields, so teams will have 4 members, at least two of them female.
text-dataton-3: To enter the competition as a team every member must have a ticket to the event and the team must fill the form with the members info. If you lack of members for your team
text-dataton-33: , we will help you find team members.
text-dataton-4: The approximately hours of the event: from 9 in the morning to 8 in the evening.
text-conferences-1: On June 2nd, the first day of the Call Of Data there will be 10 talks about data, algorithms and the technical side of the data science.
text-conferences-2: We will have 6 speakers, experts in data science, who will share their knowledge about data and will inspire teams for their next day competition.
text-conferences-3: We have a call for papers open to fill 4 lightning talks about data (20~25 minutes). The call for papers is anonymous, you can fill it here.
text-conferences-4: The approximately hours of the event: from 9 in the morning to 8 in the evening.
